clinical_study.brief_title: Tumor Electric Fields Treatment System for Glioblastoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Single-center, Single-arm, Exploratory Study on the Treatment of Recurrent Glioblastoma With Tumor Electric Fields Treatment System

lead_sponsor.agency: Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

collaborator.agency: Hunan An Tai Kang Cheng Biotechnology Co., Ltd

clinical_study.source: Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: This early phase I trial will investigate the safety and feasibility of applying the Tumor Electric Fields Treatment System to subjects with recurrent glioblastoma.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects who have previously completed radiotherapy and at least two cycles of chemotherapy with imaging or pathological evidence of tumor recurrence will receive Tumor Electric Fields Treatment System. The main objective is to evaluate the safety of applying the Tumor Electric Fields Treatment System to subjects with recurrent GBM.

primary_outcome.description: Number of patients who experienced a treatment-related adverse event.
Time to progression of patients with recurrent glioblastoma.
Number of patients alive at 12 months.

arm_group.description: Patients have a histologically confirmed diagnosis of supratentorial glioblastoma that is recurrent. All patients will receive Tumor Electric Fields Treatment System.

intervention.description: Patients wear two pairs of electrodes on the head for 19-22 hours a day. Each patient is required to wear the device as long as possible and not less than 6 months. The treatment has a two-day break for every four weeks.
